page.title: 08SPRINGFIELDS _ SPALDING
page.content: { Springfields}is situated one mile east of the town centre of Spalding. It is a show garden for the horticultural industry, displaying Spring and Summer flowers. The gardens are open from March to September. Springfields was founded in l966 and since that time well over two million visitors have seen the displays of flowers. It was founded to promote the study of tulips, daffodils, hyacinths roses and other plants. Many horticultural firms who support the gardens supply much of the plant material because the gardens are a registered charity and so only receive money from visitors attending the gardens. Springfields employ between 20 to 100 people depending on the season. Each Spring the floats used in the Flower Parade can be seen here.
